item.title: Reduced Spoke Bicycles : Conceptual Bike
item.description:
Reduced Spoke Bicycles : Conceptual Bike

Conceptual Bike - Ion Lucin has simplified the design of a standard two-wheeler with his conceptual bike Baik that opts for three-spoked wheels, a limited use of lin...

item.title: Spotify's Design Lead on Why Side Projects Should Be Stupid
item.description:
Spotify's Design Lead on Why Side Projects Should Be Stupid

Tobias van Schneider lives his life like one big side project. Today, he designs and builds new products for Spotify in New York, but he couldn't have predicted that when he dropped out of school at age 15 to work as an apprentice in a computer shop in Austria.

item.title: What it's like to ride in the Tesla Model 3
item.description:
What it's like to ride in the Tesla Model 3

HAWTHORNE, California - I've had a terrible flu all week. My body aches, my head is pounding, and my throat feels like it might fall out of my neck. Right now, though, I'm riding in the Tesla Model 3, one of the most hotly anticipated cars in the world...

item.title: The Ars VR headset showdown-Oculus Rift vs. HTC Vive
item.description:
The Ars VR headset showdown-Oculus Rift vs. HTC Vive

In our original reviews of the Oculus Rift and the HTC Vive, we tried very hard to examine these virtual reality systems on their own merits without constant comparisons to the competition. But no product exists in a vacuum. After years of buildup, we're now faced with two competitive, PC-tethered VR headsets hitting the market right next to each other.

item.title: How A Man's Fitbit Got Him The Medical Care He Needed
item.description:
How A Man's Fitbit Got Him The Medical Care He Needed

On Jan. 5, a man checked into a hospital's emergency room in Camden, New Jersey. Because his heart was beating irregularly, doctors suspected he had atrial fibrillation, the most common type of arrhythmia, which can increase the risk of stroke. But to decide how to treat him, they needed to know exactly how long his heart had been acting up.

item.title: Best of CH 2015: Instagram
item.description:
Best of CH 2015: Instagram

Four and a half years ago we joined Instagram and have posted over 2,500 images since. More than 99% of the photographs we share, we ourselves have taken, and that's something we're quite proud of.

item.title: Headspace App Launches Personal Meditative Pods
item.description:
Headspace App Launches Personal Meditative Pods

More than five million people globally have used guided meditation service Headspace. There's an invaluable ease to using their service (especially the free app) and it has opened the doors of meditation to many. Now, the acclaimed team behind the app have produced a different sort of tool for meditation: a private nature-inspired pod made in collaboration with architect duo Oyler Wu.
